checkersBoard
Class DefaultCheckersBoard

java.lang.Object
  checkersMain.CheckersBoard
      checkersBoard.DefaultCheckersBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class DefaultCheckersBoard
extends CheckersBoard

This is a Default implementation of a CheckersBoard. It implements caching of plies and successor boards, and it uses a straightforward storage of the board as an array of bytes. It uses SoftReferences for the plies and successor boards to prevent OutOfMemoryErrors.

Version:
1.21 - 7 August 2008
Author:
Jeremy Hoffman (v1.00), Amos Yuen

getNumPlies

public int getNumPlies()
Description copied from class: CheckersBoard
Returns the number of possible plies, which should correspond with the number of successor boards. This method should return the same value as CheckersBoard.getNumSuccessors(), but in the case that nothing is cached, it will create a list of plies to determine the plies count.

Specified by:
getNumPlies in class CheckersBoard
Returns:
the number of possible plies
See Also:
CheckersBoard.getPly(int)

getNumSuccessors

public int getNumSuccessors()
Description copied from class: CheckersBoard
Returns the number of successor boards, which should correspond with the number of possible plies. This method should return the same value as CheckersBoard.getNumPlies(), but in the case that nothing is cached, it will create a list of successor boards to determine the plies count.

Specified by:
getNumSuccessors in class CheckersBoard
Returns:
the number of successor boards
See Also:
CheckersBoard.getSuccessor(int)

public byte getPiece(int index)
Description copied from class: CheckersBoard
Returns the contents of the specified board location.

Specified by:
getPiece in class CheckersBoard
Parameters:
index - - board location in the range [0,31] (top-left corner being zero and bottom-right corner being 31. The index increases from left-to-right first, then from top-to-bottom)
Returns:
one of CheckersBoard.PLAYER1_CHECKER, CheckersBoard.PLAYER1_KING, CheckersBoard.PLAYER2_CHECKER, CheckersBoard.PLAYER2_KING, CheckersBoard.EMPTY, or CheckersBoard.OFFBOARD

getPly

public CheckersBoard.Ply getPly(int index)
Description copied from class: CheckersBoard
Assuming it's Player1's turn, it returns the possible ply corresponding to the passed index. The indices of the plies in the returned list should correspond to the indices of the successor boards in the list returned from CheckersBoard.getSuccessor(int).

Specified by:
getPly in class CheckersBoard
Parameters:
index - - the index of the ply to retrieve
Returns:
the ply corresponding to the passed index
See Also:
CheckersBoard.getNumPlies(), CheckersBoard.Ply

getSuccessor

public DefaultCheckersBoard getSuccessor(int index)
Description copied from class: CheckersBoard
Assuming it's Player1's turn, it returns the CheckersBoard resulting from the ply at the corresponding index. The indices of the successor boards returned should correspond to the indices of the plies returned from CheckersBoard.getPly(int).

Specified by:
getSuccessor in class CheckersBoard
Parameters:
index - - the index of the successor to retrieve
Returns:
the resulting CheckersBoard from the corresponding ply
See Also:
CheckersBoard.getNumSuccessors()

invertCheckersBoard

public DefaultCheckersBoard invertCheckersBoard()
Description copied from class: CheckersBoard
Creates a new board and it switches Player2 and Player1 pieces and up and down directions, effectively allowing it to always be "PLAYER1's turn" and Player1 to always be moving "up" even as play alternates between two players. The inverted CheckersBoard will be cached. Note: this method in combination with the caching of successor boards can cause memory to not be released. Use the freeCache() method to help with this.

Specified by:
invertCheckersBoard in class CheckersBoard
Returns:
the inverted CheckersBoard
